content.raw: Ok, this has been a nightmare to try to sort out. I'm using Gazebo with the "gazebo_ros" package for ROS, which likely has something to do with old versions of things being installed. Installing "gazebo_ros" automatically installs a specific version of Gazebo (2.x) that it is compatible with. It looks like maybe the SDF models in the database were updated to 1.5, which is not compatible with Gazebo 2.x? But I can't install a newer version of Gazebo, because then it won't be compatible with ROS. So, looks like I'm pretty boned with this one. Three cheers for backwards compatibility...
content.html: Ok, this has been a nightmare to try to sort out. I'm using Gazebo with the "gazebo_ros" package for ROS, which likely has something to do with old versions of things being installed. Installing "gazebo_ros" automatically installs a specific version of Gazebo (2.x) that it is compatible with. It looks like maybe the SDF models in the database were updated to 1.5, which is not compatible with Gazebo 2.x? But I can't install a newer version of Gazebo, because then it won't be compatible with ROS. So, looks like I'm pretty boned with this one. Three cheers for backwards compatibility...
